g.text: Int. J. Environ. Res. Public Health
Applying the public health core functions and essential services model to climate change.
Some Key Available Tools for Health and Climate
Climate services for projecting health outcomes
Disease surveillance (required syndromic surveillance and health and
Adaptive risk assessment for population health risks due to climate hazards
Collaboration, coordination, partnerships across agencies, levels,
Mitigation action planning for health sector
Adaptation intervention planning for population health outcomes
Communication on health risks of climate hazards, resilience promoting
Early warning systems (heat, ﬂooding, vector borne disease, air pollution)
Nature-based solutions to reduce heat, ﬂood risks
Health impact assessment (integration of health outcomes in
Hospital and health care extreme event preparedness
Climate change curriculumfor public health, medical schools
‘Good practice’ city climate change networks with health focus
Adapted from US CDC Building Resilience Against Climate E
ects Framework (BRACE) and the EU Climate-ADAPT Framework;
Concepts that enhance the core functions and
